2x4 STRAPPING ON FACE OF GABLE END TRUSS
FASTEN GABLE END TRUSS TO TOP PLATE w/ 3-1/2" NAILS @ 16" o.c. OR FASTEN GABLE END TRUSS TO EACH THROUGH STUD w/ (3) 3-1/2" NAILS OR "POST WALLS ONLY FASTEN GABLED END TRUSS TO POSTS w/ (6) 4" NAILS.
SPACING AS SPECIFIED BY BRACE DESIGNER
48'-0" MAXIMUM
2x4 STRUT x 5'-0" LONG @ TOP & BOTTOM WITH (2) 3-1/2" NAILS @ EACH TRUSS WEB MEMBER
ANCHOR 2x4 DIAGONAL BRACE TO LATERAL WITH (4) 3-1/2" NAILS @ INTERSECTION OF TRUSS WEB & TRUSS LATERAL
2x4 DIAGONAL "X" BRACE ON OPPOSITE SIDE OF TRUSS AT ENDWALLS & WHERE SPECIFIED ELSEWHERE
ANCHOR 2x4 DIAGONAL "X" ON OPPOSITE SIDE OF WEB WITH (2) 3-1/2" NAILS @ EACH TRUSS
ANCHOR DIAGONAL BRACE TO STRUT @ BOTH ENDS WITH (4) 3-1/2" NAILS
BUTT 2x4 LATERALS @ ALL SPLICE LOCATIONS. ENSURE BUTT JOINT IS TIGHT & CENTERED ON TRUSS WEB.
LAP 2x4 DIAGONAL (MIN. 2 TRUSSES) TO ENSURE DIAGONAL BRACE EXTENDS COMPLETELY FROM TOP CHORD TO BOTTOM CHORD OF TRUSS. (AS REQUIRED)
ROOF TRUSS BRACING NOTES
1. CONTRACTOR AND/OR OWNER TO NOTIFY MANUFACTURER OF ANY TRUSS DEFICIENCIES SUCH AS DAMAGED OR BROKEN TRUSSES, WARPING OF TRUSS MEMBERS, AND MISSING OR OFFSET TRUSS PLATES.
2. DIAGONAL BRACING MUST BE PROVIDED ON ALL WEB MEMBERS THAT REQUIRE LATERAL BRACING. DIAGONAL BRACING SHALL BE SPACED AS NOTED ON THE ATTACHED DRAWING(S). X-BRACING SHALL BE PROVIDED AT ENDWALL AND AT INTERVALS NOTED ON THE ROOF PLAN.
3. PERMANENT LATERAL BRACING TO BE INSTALLED ON WEB MEMBERS AS INDICATED ON THE ROOF PLAN AND MANUFACTURERS DRAWINGS.
4. PROVIDE DIAGONAL BRACING AT ALL DISCONTINUITIES IN LATERAL BRACING SUCH AS WHERE TRUSS TYPE CHANGES THE TRUSS SUPPLIER SHALL DESIGN THE TRUSSES FOR THE BRACING NOTED. BRACING DETAILS WILL NOT BE MODIFIED UNLESS SPECIFIED BY THE BUILDING DESIGNER.
5. TRUSS SUPPLIER WILL DESIGN TRUSSES FOR BRACING NOTED. BRACING DETAILS WILL NOT BE MODIFIED UNLESS SPECIFIED BY THE BUILDING DESIGNER.
images.summary: This detail illustrates the truss bracing system for a roof structure. Pre-engineered trusses are aligned with the wood stud wall below, as indicated by the note 'ALIGN TRUSSES w/ STUD BELOW (TYP. U.N.O.)'. Uplift clips are specified per the truss manufacturer's design, and trusses are toe-nailed to the top plate with 3-inch nails. The detail includes 2x4 struts and diagonal bracing for stability, with specific nailing instructions such as '2x4 STRUT x 5'-0" LONG @ TOP & BOTTOM WITH (2) 3-1/2" NAILS @ EACH TRUSS WEB MEMBER'. The roof truss bracing notes emphasize the importance of notifying the manufacturer of any truss deficiencies and ensuring proper diagonal bracing on web members. The notes also specify that the truss supplier will design the trusses for the bracing noted, ensuring compliance with the building designer's specifications.

images.summary: This section view shows a typical foundation wall detail labeled as 'CW8'. The foundation wall is constructed of 8-inch concrete and includes reinforcement with 15M verticals spaced at 36 inches on center, and horizontal reinforcement at the top, mid-height, and grade. The P.T. sill plate is secured with 1/2-inch diameter anchor bolts spaced at 48 inches on center, with openings left at door locations. The foundation rests on a continuous concrete strip footing measuring 24 inches by 8 inches, reinforced with two 15M continuous bars. The footing is designed to bear on undisturbed native soil or compacted fill as approved by a geotechnical engineer. The section is identified as '1/S1.0'.

Reinforcement includes two 15M continuous bars at the top of the wall and 10M bars at 12 inches on center at all door locations. The grade slopes away from the building. This section is labeled as '3/S1.0'.

images.summary: This section details the overhead door lintel with a built-up post. The lintel consists of a steel beam secured with 1/2-inch bolts staggered at 24 inches on center. The section specifies pre-engineered roof trusses and truss uplift clips per manufacturer drawings. The framing includes double top plates and typical stud framing. Bolt requirements vary based on beam size, with specifications provided for W8 to W24 beams. The section also includes sub-framing details and connections for door hardware fastening. The section is labeled as '2/S1.0'.

images.summary: This foundation plan for the proposed addition shows a rectangular layout with dimensions of 100'-0" by 70'-0". It includes specific instructions for providing 15M x 18" dowels at 24 inches on center into existing footings and walls, with a minimum embedment of 4 inches. The plan advises against undermining existing footings or walls. The foundation plan also specifies dropping walls at door locations to 6 inches below the finished floor, with the floor poured over these areas. Section callouts '1/S1.0' indicate where sections are cut through the plan. Element callouts 'F1', 'S1', and 'CWB' identify specific foundation and wall elements. Key components include concrete footings and rebar dowels.

images.text_verbatim:
ASSEMBLY SCHEDULE
R1 TYPICAL ROOF CONSTRUCTION:
• 29 Ga. STEEL ROOFING
• 2x4 STRAPPING @ 24" o.c.
• ROOF FRAMING AS PER PLANS
F1 TYPICAL SLAB ON GRADE CONSTRUCTION:
• FLOOR FINISH (PER OWNER)
• 6" CONCRETE FLOOR SLAB
• 6" COMPACTED GRANULAR 'A' FILL
WE1 EXTERIOR WALL CONSTRUCTION (TYP. U.N.O.):
• 29 Ga. PREFIN. METAL CLADDING
• TYPAR AIR BARRIER, JOINTS TAPED
• 2x4 STRAPPING @ 24" o.c.
• 2x8 WOOD STUDS @ 24" o.c.
• OR, 2x6 WOOD STUDS @ 16" o.c.
• SOLID BLOCKING @ 48" o.c.
DOUBLE SHEARWALL (AS INDICATED):
• 1/2" PLYWOOD ON BOTH SIDES FASTENED w/ 2-3/8" NAIL-GUN NAILS @ 4" o.c. PANEL EDGES & 12" o.c. IN FIELD. PROVIDE BLOCKING AT 24" o.c. AND ALL PANEL EDGES. PROVIDE (3)-PLY STUD POST EACH END OF SHEARWALL. (TYP. U.N.O.) SEE TYPICAL DETAIL.
NOTE: PROVIDE SOLID BLOCKING @ 48" o.c. IN ALL WALLS TALLER THAN 9'-6".
images.summary: The assembly schedule outlines specifications for various construction components. Typical roof construction (R1) includes 29 Ga. steel roofing, 2x4 strapping at 24 inches on center, and roof framing as per plans. Typical slab on grade construction (F1) consists of a floor finish per owner, a 6-inch concrete floor slab, and 6-inch compacted granular 'A' fill. Exterior wall construction (WE1) involves 29 Ga. prefinished metal cladding, a Typar air barrier with taped joints, and options for 2x8 wood studs at 24 inches on center or 2x6 wood studs at 16 inches on center, with solid blocking at 48 inches on center. The double shearwall is specified with 1/2-inch plywood on both sides, fastened with 2-3/8-inch nail-gun nails at 4 inches on center at panel edges and 12 inches on center in the field, with blocking at 24 inches on center and all panel edges. A note specifies solid blocking at 48 inches on center in walls taller than 9'-6".

2-2x6 BRACING CONNECTION
1/2" = 1'-0"
NOTES:
1. 2x6 BRACE IS TO BE CONTINUOUS AND END @ STUD CONNECTION TO PLATE.
2. DO NOT NOTCH BRACES INTO STUDS.
3. INSTALL BRACES AT APPROXIMATELY 45 deg. ANGLES.
4. MINIMUM NAIL SPACING OF 1-1/4".
(3)-PLY SOLID BLOCKING BETWEEN STUDS FASTEN w/ (6) 3-1/2" NAILS THROUGH FACE & (3) NAILS THROUGH STUD INTO EACH END OF EACH BLOCK.
(2) 3-1/2" COMMON SPIRAL NAILS INTO EACH STUD. (TYP.)
(2) 1/2"dia. x6" lg. WEDGE ANCHOR @ EACH BRACE LOCATION. (TYP.)
TOP CONNECTION
BOTTOM CONNECTION

images.summary: This section view illustrates a 2x6 bracing connection, focusing on the top and bottom connections of diagonal braces. The section is labeled '3/S2.0' and provides detailed notes on installation. The 2x6 brace must be continuous and end at the stud connection to the plate, installed at approximately 45-degree angles. Braces should not be notched into studs, and the minimum nail spacing is 1-1/4 inches. Solid blocking is specified as 3-ply between studs, fastened with six 3-1/2-inch nails through the face and three nails through the stud into each end of each block. Each brace requires 12 common spiral nails at both the top and bottom of the wall. Additionally, 1/2-inch diameter by 6-inch long wedge anchors are used at each brace location. Key components include the 2x6 diagonal brace, solid blocking, and nails.

images.summary: This building section, labeled '1/S2.0', provides a longitudinal view of the roof structure and foundation. It details the continuous 2x6 X-bracing fastened to the top side of the bottom chord, with installation required on all trusses. Lateral bracing is to be as per the truss manufacturer's engineer, with details shown on pre-engineered truss shop drawings. Prefinished metal fascia, eavestrough, and vented soffit are specified per owner requirements. Continuous ridge venting is to be installed per Ontario Building Code and manufacturer specifications. Truss uplift clips are required at each end, and a double top plate is continuous. The section specifies a pressure-treated sill plate with a sill gasket and 1/2-inch diameter anchor bolts at 48 inches on center, with openings left at door locations. Concrete foundations are to bear on undisturbed native soil or compacted fill approved by a geotechnical engineer. Key components include trusses, concrete foundations, and wall strapping.

images.summary: This detail shows a shearwall with a plywood wall schedule fastened using 2-3/8" nailgun nails at 4" on center at panel edges and 12" on center in the field. Solid blocking is provided at 24" on center and at all panel edges, with the top of the wall secured to the truss as per the roof plan. The shearwall includes a 3-ply stud post at each end, secured to an L5x3x1/4" angle LVL with a 5/8" diameter by 8" long hooked anchor into the concrete foundation wall. The section callout '4/S2.0' indicates the reference for this detail. The detail specifies securing the 3-ply post to the angle with eight 5/16" diameter by 3" long wood lag screws, typical for the assembly.

images.summary: This section illustrates the construction details of a slider door at the eave and lintel. It includes pre-engineered roof trusses with truss uplift clips as per manufacturer drawings. The section shows a prefinished metal drip edge and fascia, with an eavestrough and vented soffit per owner specifications. The steel beam is secured with 2x6 or 2x8 plates using 1/2" bolts at 24" on center, staggered on the flange sides. The 2x10 plate is secured to studs with six 3-1/2" nails per stud. The sliding door assembly includes door track, hardware, and cover by others. Sub-framing below the beam accommodates typical stud size and spacing, with continuous 2x6 or 2x8 at the opening head. The section callout '2/S2.0' references this detail.

images.summary: This plan shows the roof truss framing layout, featuring pre-engineered wood trusses. The trusses are detailed with continuous 2x6 bracing fastened directly to the top side of the truss bottom chord, typical for the assembly. The plan specifies extending strapping into the existing roof with a minimum 8'-0" staggered joints. Gable end trusses are fastened to the plate with 3-1/2" nails at 6" on center or through the stud with three 3-1/2" nails, typical for both gable ends. The plan does not include specific section callouts but provides essential information for roof truss installation and bracing.
